p: SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV. Both single-stranded RNA viruses share 82% nucleotide identity, and SARS-CoV-2 shares 89% identity with SARS-like CoVZXC21 [ 35]. The genome of SARS-CoV-2 has 29,891 nucleotides encoding 9,860 amino acids. Genetically, SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV (about 79%) and MERS-CoV (about 50%) [ 36]. The virus contains a replicase, spike (S) protein, envelope (E) protein, membrane (M) protein and nucleocapsid [ 35] ( Figure 1A & B). However, SARS-CoV-2 lacks the hemagglutinin-esterase gene, which is found in lineage A β-COVs.
